Incumbency status. (I = Incumbent, C = Challenger, O = Open Seat Candidate, blank - not up for election).
Candidate gender codings
Recipient’s CFscore, as a measure of their political ideology or beliefs, based on donations received
Period-specific estimates of ideology. (Candidate/recipient scores are re-estimated in each election cycle while holding contributor scores constant.)
Ideological measures for recipients
(voteview.com) First dimension common-space DW-NOMINATE score. (Based on joint scaling of the 1st to the 117th Congresses.)
(voteview.com) Second dimension common-space DW-NOMINATE score.
(voteview.com) First dimension Nokken-Poole period-specific DW-NOMINATE score. (Scores for the House and Senate are scaled separately and thus should not be directly compared.)
(voteview.com) Second dimension Nokken-Poole period-specific DW-NOMINATE score.
Estimates of ideology for recipients/candidates from IRT count-model applied to PAC data.
Composite ideological score for recipients, combining information from multiple sources
Number of distinct donors that gave to the candidate during a specific election cycle
Number of distinct donors that gave to the candidate/recipient aggregating over the candidate/recipient’s career.
Sum total of contributions raised during an election cycle
Sum total campaign disbursements during an election cycle.
Sum total of itemized contributions from individuals raised during an election cycle
Sum of unitemized contributions from individuals raised during an election cycle.
Sum total contributions raised from contributions from PACs and other committees.

Sum total raised from candidate self-contributions.
Sum total independent expenditures made to support the candidate.
Sum total independent expenditures made to oppose the candidate.
FEC reported vote share in primary election. Primary election outcomes are only coded for federal congressional candidates.
Primary election outcome (’W’ = won election; ’L’ = lost election). Primary election outcomes are only coded for federal congressional candidates.
FEC reported vote share in general election.
FEC special election code (W = Win) (L = Lose).
FEC run-off election code (W = Win) (L = Lose).
District-level percentage of the two-party vote share won by the Democratic presidential nominee in the most recent (or concurrent) presidential election.

Indicates the status of the candidate’s campaign assigned by the FEC. (C = Statutory candidate; F = Statutory candidate for future election; N = Not yet a statutory candidate; P = Statutory candidate in prior cycle)
FEC code for type of committee.

Adjusted ICPSR legislator ID. Candidates that have never served in Congress are assigned IDs based off of their candidate IDs assigned by the FEC, NIMSP, or state reporting agencies. The four-digit election cycle is appended to the ID. Candidates that are active in multiple election cycles (or file to run for multiple seats during a single election cycle) will appear multiple times. This variable provides a unique row identifier

Adjusted ICPSR legislator ID. Candidates that have never served in Congress are assigned IDs based off of their candidate IDs assigned by the FEC, NIMSP, or state reporting agencies. Party switchers are assigned new ICPSR2 IDs after switching parties. (See before.switch.ICPSR and after.switch.ICPSR.)
The candidate ID assigned by the FEC or state reporting agency.
The committee ID assigned by the FEC or state reporting agency campaign committee.
(CRP/NIMSP) Unique candidate IDs assigned by the Center for Responsive Politics/National Institute for Money in State Politics.
ICPSR ID prior to switching parties (included for party-switchers only).
ICPSR ID after switching parties (included for party-switchers only).
Original party before switch.
(nimsp) three-letter party code assigned by the NIMSP
(nimsp) incumbency status assigned by the NIMSP.
(nimsp) district number assigned by the NIMSP.
(nimsp) state-office sought.
(nimsp) election outcome.
Year of special election, if special election occurred because of resignation or death of incumbent
Election cycle year of special election, if special election occurred because of resignation or death of incumbent
Full name of incumbent (candidate) that either resigned or passed away
Party of incumbent (candidate) that either resigned or passed away
Date of resignation of incumbent (candidate), includes death dates as well. Note: Not retrieved for all candidates that resigned, but applies to all candidates that passed away.
Date of death of incumbent (candidate). Note: Retrieved for all candidates that passed away.

Date special election date was held in for district-cycle, following resignation or death of candidate. Note: Not retrieved for all candidates that resigned, but applies to all candidates that passed away.
Cause of vacancy (Death or Resigned)
Age of candidate when they passed away
Cause that led to death of candidate. Contains description that was used to construct death_unexpected
Dummy variable indicating if death of candidate was unexpected or not (1 if yes, 0 if not), based on the cause of the death.
Year of resignation or death. Note: Not retrieved for all candidates that resigned, but applies to all candidates that passed away.
Number of congress election was held retrieved at from Wikipedia page. Note: not retrieved for all candidates.
Number of original candidate retrieved from Wikipedia page. Note: not retrieved for all candidates.
Cause of vacancy retrieved from Wikipedia page. Note: not retrieved for all candidates.
Winner of special elections, retrieved from Wikipedia page. Note: not retrieved for all candidates.
District of candidate retrieved from Wikipedia. Note: not retrieved for all candidates.
Date of the general election held at that election cycle. Used to enhance logic of treatment variables

Dummy variable that indicates if a contribution in the same cycle of the death came later than the date of the special election (1), or earlier (0). Missing value indicates special elections did not occur in that specific district-cycle (we know if a special election happened in that district-cycle if the DIME contributions and recipients data is merged with the special_elections data).

description: Dummy variable that indicates if a contribution is going towards a special election, as indicated by Bonica's election.type variable. Gets value 1 if election.type == 'S', else 0 (belongs to G, P, or R).
origin_dataset: contribDB_1980.csv to contribDB_2024.csv ; dime_recipients_1979_2024.csv ; special_elections_final.csv, election_dates.csv

description: Counts the number of days between the contribution date and the date of the nearest death in the district
origin_dataset: contribDB_1980.csv to contribDB_2024.csv ; dime_recipients_1979_2024.csv ; special_elections_final.csv, election_dates.csv

description: Absolute value of days_to_nearest_death
origin_dataset: contribDB_1980.csv to contribDB_2024.csv ; dime_recipients_1979_2024.csv ; special_elections_final.csv, election_dates.csv

description: First dummy we use to measure the impact of the death of an incumbent on contributions. For single death districts, we assign values of 0 before death of the incumbent, and 1 after death (based on whether the contribution is coming before or after death_date). For multiple death districts, we assume first death is the only death, hence we assign 0 to all contributions coming before the first death of an incumbent in that district's history, and 1 to contributions coming after the death.
origin_dataset: contribDB_1980.csv to contribDB_2024.csv ; dime_recipients_1979_2024.csv ; special_elections_final.csv, election_dates.csv

description: Second dummy we use to measure the impact of the death of an incumbent on contributions. For single death districts, we repeat the logic we used for these districts in treat_1. For multiple death districts, we assign 0 to all contributions coming before the first death of an incumbent in that district's history, 1 to contributions coming after the first death up until the end of the election cycle in which the special elections happened. In the new election cycle the values are set back to 0. This is repeated for the second death, and all other deaths.
origin_dataset: contribDB_1980.csv to contribDB_2024.csv ; dime_recipients_1979_2024.csv ; special_elections_final.csv, election_dates.csv
